lines.text: [Jimmy and Denny rescue Dale from a runaway horse, but it turns out she didn't want to be rescued]
You're all right now!
That's what you think, tall, dark and meddlesome.
[in order to rescue Denny from arrest on bogus murder charges, Lasses poses as the Sheriff]
Oh, Sheriff! Don't you want to view the remains?
He's dead - I reckon he'll wait.
[the Sheriff repeatedly disparages Lasses' age]
Old duffer? Last time, I was an old codger, darn him.
Why don't you come outside?
No, it's past my bedtime.
Goin' to bed in your riding clothes? 'Course it's a good idea if you're going to have nightmares.
[Dale repeatedly refers to Jimmy and Denny as the Rover Boys]
Are you following me, Rover?
Yes, and I wish you'd quit callin' me, "Rover".
Why not, you're doggin' my steps.
B-but, you're supposed to be dead!
Well, in that case we'd better have a seance.
[wandering around an abandoned mine is getting on Lasses' nerves]
We've been walkin' a long time. I hope my knees hold up.
If you quit knockin' 'em together, they will.
